intro: Rytigynia gillettii, commonly known as the Gillett's rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as citrus. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or white. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat understudied species.
